bboxes.raw_text:
This week have been given
bit more than a half of my regular
column to fill. For while
thought l would compose some
lyrical lines about Columbus or
write some musings on National
Newsboys Day.


Try as ! might nothing
came our but some lame
limericks, SALUTE TO
NEWS.#7 (Or verses to end the
day..


/. There was an old reporter/
Who developed goiter/ From
eating cold cheese and beer/ He
ran down a story Scooping all
others, won glory/ Now he dimes
on steak.


2. | met small. hungry waif
selling/ Newspapers on the
streets/ He cried for a sale
telling Of the latest heroes and
beats/ He grew up, bought some
mining stock/ Now he dimes on
caviar.


8. Winken, Blinken, Elvis and
Nod/ Went out to sea on surf
boat/ They sped past Cape Cody
Later they capsized and had to
float. Papers reported only
Blinken could swim.


Moral Some make the news,
some sell papers and others
drown.

Siqhts and Sounds
ELolse BANKS


PotpoUrri

First President to return to G on
gress after his Presidential
term John Quincy Adams. Gle
served in the House of Repre-
sentatives for II years after
being President. He Is the only
President to have returned to
Congress.)

Last Wednesday addressed meeting Of executives Motooa
Incorporated the human relations symposium
traced the historical development of employing minority groups
presented many facts possible concerning
trends.


valuable information from summaries compiled by
Employment Service especially of Carl
Craig minority conutant and the Phoenix Human Relations
Commission headed by William Reilly


amazing that although the population increase in
the Greater Phoenix the decade 10000 estimated
only of the total is nonwhite including
Negro Oriental and Indian.


year 1860 the turning point the employment picture,
that the when Negroes being hired in other
Jobs than service positions as teachers.


open here and businesses expandthere
opportunities for of all creed and coors
Jobs avaablebut often qualified applicants
the responsibility Of teachers, minister's labor
leaders, and other who reach STU
inform them Of the opportunities in business and
industry.


vocational technical guidance needed Unions must allow
Negroes apprenticeship programs.


Continued weekly

Views, PREvIEws
MD Reviews


Edward Banks

If you played Little League
baseball this summer, you had
plenty of company. Some LIP
million boys belonged to $4,000
teams in 6,100 local leagues in
26 countries. Looks like the
majors have plenty Of potential
talent on the way up.

There's nothing revolutionary about our method
of getting business. We just follow the tlme-hon-
ored practice of coming right out and asking for 1t
- and then thanking folks when they oblige us.
Of course, it isn't quite as simple as that We 90
have a number of other things going for us. Like
the overwhelming preference of auto dealers. Fast
loan approvals. Low bank rates. And friendly
helpful people, Oh, yes, and convenient locations
~ If them at last count - with more on the way
So if one of the new 65 model cars has caught
YOUR fancy, settle on the price, then tell your
dealer YOU want Valley Bank financing! lhats


all there is to it.

Mr.. Valley Banker - -
tallies the score to be 1 out OF A!

EDWARD BANKS, OBSERVATION-DISCLOSURES


ELOISE BANKS, ASSISTANT EDITOR
